column4: I've tried both the apt-get update and upgrade as well as software updates and I don't think they operate exactly the same. What do you think?
they achieve the same end
you just get to see what is going on, plus any errors will be shown. The GUI apps don't really show that

I've noticed a big difference when loading systems if I use apt-get verses software update. What I notice is that the software update seems to not work in the same order as it would if I didn't uses aopt-get
Meaning I end up with a different system load based on which style i choose
do you mean load as in CPU usage?
This is just one thing I've noticed over the years. No I mean a different set of packages and updates
the packages and deps are identical, so the same packages will be updated and installed
The system performs differently based on the procedure. I tend to stick with software updates until they are complete then I use apt-get
the required packages are read for each package and satisfied
Why inconsistency then?
i'm very sure its identical, otherwise you would gen an inconsistant package state if deps are not all met
itd be a massive bug and would have been sorted ages ago as it is a fundamental foundation of the OS
So you are saying that software update does the exact same thing in the exact same order as apt-get update and upgrade?
yes, its just a pretty GUI,some insall the recommended packages, others don't but they will definately install what is needed for the application to run as expected
where have you heard this from?
Its been my experience I've loading ubuntu since version 6
there is no version 6, there is 6.06 and 6.10
I've used ubuntu since Gutsy (7.10)
I've loaded Ubuntu 500 +/-. I just noticed this again and again sometimes more than others but definately noticed that the order matters.
then I suggest you report a bug
